Intro

Experienced Program Manager with a strong background in finance and a passion for data analysis. Currently working for the Government of the District of Columbia, leading strategic initiatives and driving operational efficiency. Skilled in Excel, Tableau, and Power BI, adept at translating complex data into actionable insights and compelling visuals..

Possessing a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance, I have a solid foundation in financial analysis and reporting. Leveraging my analytical mindset, I am currently expanding my skill set by learning SQL and Python, enabling me to explore data more effectively and extract meaningful information.

Throughout my career, I have successfully managed diverse projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to achieve project goals and deliver high-quality results. I thrive in dynamic environments, adapting quickly to change and leveraging data-driven approaches to inform decision-making.

Passionate about leveraging data to drive organizational growth and improve outcomes, I am continuously seeking opportunities to optimize processes, identify trends, and uncover insights that inform strategic decision-making. I am eager to apply my expertise in data analysis, combined with my program management skills, to contribute to the success of forward-thinking organizations.

If you're interested in connecting or discussing opportunities related to data analysis, program management, or financial analysis, please feel free to reach out. Let's collaborate and make a positive impact together.

Projects

  • Excel 1: Bike Sales Dashboard

  • Excel 2: Kohl's Firm Valuation

  • Tableau: Washington, DC AirBnB Data Analysis

  • Power BI: Data Professional Survey

About

Hello, I'm David Sarcione, a driven professional with a diverse background and a passion for learning and growth. Originally from Massachusetts, I relocated to Northern Virginia in 2006 and embarked on an exciting journey in the transportation industry.

During my time in Virginia, I had the opportunity to work for both Flexcar and Zipcar, where I gained invaluable experience in the realm of shared mobility and transportation solutions. These roles allowed me to develop a strong understanding of customer needs, effective communication, and problem-solving skills.

In the summer of 2007, I joined the Washington DC Department of Public Works (DC DPW), and I have been contributing to the organization's mission ever since. As a dedicated member of the DC DPW team, I have taken on various responsibilities and challenges, constantly striving for excellence in my work.

Parallel to my professional endeavors, I pursued my academic goals. I enrolled in George Mason University and successfully earned my Bachelor of Science degree in Finance. This educational journey not only provided me with a solid foundation in financial principles but also honed my critical thinking abilities and analytical skills.

I am an enthusiastic learner, always seeking opportunities to enhance my data analysis skills and stay up to date with the latest trends in my field. I strongly believe in the power of continuous improvement and believe that by constantly expanding my knowledge base, I can make meaningful contributions to any team or organization.

Outside of work and academics, I enjoy various hobbies and interests. I find solace in reading, exploring new cuisines, and engaging in outdoor activities that allow me to stay active and appreciate nature.

Overall, I am a dedicated professional with a strong work ethic, a commitment to personal and professional growth, and a genuine passion for utilizing data analysis to drive informed decision-making. I look forward to embracing new challenges and making a positive impact wherever my journey takes me.

Preformatted

i = 0;

while (!deck.isInOrder()) {
    print 'Iteration ' + i;
    deck.shuffle();
    i++;
}

print 'It took ' + i + ' iterations to sort the deck.';
